original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
translated: Suvikrāntavikrāmin,

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni /
translated: bodhisattvas

original: sems can gyi 'du shes kyis bskyed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sems can gyi 'du shes kyis bskyed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: are not produced by the notion of sentient beings;

original: sems can gyi 'du shes rnam par 'jig pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi 'du shes rnam par 'jig pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
translated: they are called ‘bodhisattvas’ in order to destroy the notion of sentient beings.

original: ji skad du brjod pa bzhin du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du brjod pa bzhin du ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not as it is said.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni /
translated: Bodhisattvas

original: brjod par bya ba ma yin zhing /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ma yin zhing /
translated: are not to be expressed.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni /
translated: Bodhisattvas🔽are not to be expressed.

original: sems can gyi rang bzhin dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi rang bzhin dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is free from the nature of sentient beings.

original: byang chub ni /
analyzed: byang chub ni /
translated: Enlightenment

original: sems can du 'du shes pa dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: sems can du 'du shes pa dang bral ba ste /
translated: is free from the perception of sentient beings.

original: gang gis byang chub 'di ltar shes pa de byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis byang chub 'di ltar shes pa de byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
translated: One who knows enlightenment in this way is called a bodhisattva.

original: byang chub ji lta bur shes she na /🔽byang chub 'di ni /🔽shin tu 'das pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub ji lta bur shes she na / byang chub 'di ni / shin tu 'das pa'o //
translated: How is enlightenment known?

original: byang chub 'di ni /🔽bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub 'di ni / bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: Enlightenment is utterly transcendent.

original: byang chub 'di ni /
analyzed: byang chub 'di ni /
translated: Enlightenment is not an object of action.

original: skye ba med pa 'gog pa med pa'o //🔽byang chub ni /
analyzed: skye ba med pa 'gog pa med pa'o // byang chub ni /
translated: Enlightenment is unborn and unceasing.

original: byang chub kyis shes par mi byed /🔽byang chub ni /🔽rnam par shes pa bya ba ma yin /
analyzed: byang chub kyis shes par mi byed / byang chub ni / rnam par shes pa bya ba ma yin /
translated: Enlightenment is not to be known through enlightenment.🔽Enlightenment is not an object of consciousness.

original: rnam par rig par bya ba ma yin /
analyzed: rnam par rig par bya ba ma yin /
translated: It is not an object of cognition,

original: gdags par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gdags par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: not an object of designation.

original: mngon par ma grub pa ni /
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa ni /
translated: Non-manifestation

original: byang chub ces bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub ces bya'o //
translated: is called enlightenment.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa dang / rtog pa bcad pa'i phyir gang gis khong du chud pa dag rab tu rtogs pa de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa dang / rtog pa bcad pa'i phyir gang gis khong du chud pa dag rab tu rtogs pa de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
translated: Because it is to be understood and fully realized by those who have cut through conceptual thoughts and non-conceptuality, it is called bodhisattva.

original: 'di @14b skad du brjod pa bzhin du ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di @14b skad du brjod pa bzhin du ma yin no //
translated: It is not like that.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: sems can med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there are no sentient beings.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par dmigs na ni /🔽'di ni / byang chub /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par dmigs na ni / 'di ni / byang chub /
translated: If a bodhisattva were to be apprehended,🔽then there would be a ‘bodhi’

original: 'di ni / sems can zhes byang chub de yang rnyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni / sems can zhes byang chub de yang rnyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: and a ‘sentient being. ’🔽But the one who understands that there are no sentient beings,🔽that there is nothing that is a sentient being,

original: sems can med pa dang / sems can ma yin pa dang / sems can dang bral bar khong du chud pa ni /
analyzed: sems can med pa dang / sems can ma yin pa dang / sems can dang bral bar khong du chud pa ni /
translated: that there is no sentient being,

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
translated: is called a ‘bodhisattva. ’🔽The one who has destroyed the notion of sentient beings,🔽the one who has destroyed the notion of a sentient being,

original: sems can med pa dang / sems can du 'du shes rnam par bshig pas byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can med pa dang / sems can du 'du shes rnam par bshig pas byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
translated: is called a ‘bodhisattva. ’

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: sems can gyi khams zhes bya ba de ni /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams zhes bya ba de ni /
translated: The term ‘realm of sentient beings’

original: sems can med pa'i tshig bla dvags so //
analyzed: sems can med pa'i tshig bla dvags so //
translated: is a synonym for ‘no sentient beings. ’

original: sems can gyi khams med pa'i phyir sems can la sems can med do //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams med pa'i phyir sems can la sems can med do //
translated: Because there is no realm of sentient beings, there are no sentient beings in sentient beings.

original: gal te sems can la sems can yod na ni /
analyzed: gal te sems can la sems can yod na ni /
translated: If there were sentient beings in sentient beings,

original: sems can gyi khams zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams zhes mi bya'o //
translated: it would not be called the ‘realm of sentient beings. ’

original: sems can gyi khams zhes bya ba de ni /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams zhes bya ba de ni /
translated: The so-called realm of sentient beings

original: khams med par bstan te /
analyzed: khams med par bstan te /
translated: is taught to be a realm that does not exist.

original: khams med pa ni /
analyzed: khams med pa ni /
translated: The realm that does not exist

original: sems can gyi khams so //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams so //
translated: is the realm of sentient beings.

original: gal te sems can gyi khams sems can khams su gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te sems can gyi khams sems can khams su gyur na ni /
translated: If the realm of sentient beings were to become the realm of sentient beings,

original: srog de lus de yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srog de lus de yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the life-force would be the body.

original: ci ste sems can gyi khams las rnam par grol ba khams su gyur na ni /🔽srog kyang gzhan /
analyzed: ci ste sems can gyi khams las rnam par grol ba khams su gyur na ni / srog kyang gzhan /
translated: If the realm of sentient beings were to become liberated from the realm of sentient beings,🔽then the life-force would be one thing

original: lus kyang gzhan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus kyang gzhan du 'gyur ro //
translated: and the body another.

original: khams med pa ni /
analyzed: khams med pa ni /
translated: The realm that does not exist

original: sems can gyi khams te; brdas tha snyad du gdags pa'i tshig tu 'gro'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams te; brdas tha snyad du gdags pa'i tshig tu 'gro'o //
translated: is the realm of sentient beings, which is a term used to designate a conventional symbol.

original: sems can gyi khams la ni /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams la ni /
translated: In the realm of sentient beings,

original: khams med de /
analyzed: khams med de /
translated: there is no realm.

original: khams ma gtogs par sems can gyi khams med do //
analyzed: khams ma gtogs par sems can gyi khams med do //
translated: Apart from the realm, there is no realm of sentient beings.

original: chos thams cad ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni /
translated: All phenomena

original: khams med @15a *//🔽pa ste; ngas de la dgongs nas sems can gyi khams ni /🔽gang ba'am / bri bar yang mi mngon no //
analyzed: khams med @15a *// pa ste; ngas de la dgongs nas sems can gyi khams ni / gang ba'am / bri bar yang mi mngon no //
translated: are realms that do not exist.🔽With that in mind, I have said,

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //
translated: ‘The realm of sentient beings is not seen to increase or decrease.’

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems can gyi khams rab tu dben pa'i phyir sems can gyi khams ni /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams rab tu dben pa'i phyir sems can gyi khams ni /
translated: The realm of sentient beings is empty of the realm of sentient beings.🔽

original: sems can ma yin no //
analyzed: sems can ma yin no //
translated: The realm of sentient beings is not a sentient being because the realm of sentient beings is utterly isolated.

original: ji ltar sems can gyi khams bri ba dang / gang bar mi mngon pa bzhin du chos thams cad kyang bri ba'am gang bar mi mngon no //🔽gang dag bri ba'am /
analyzed: ji ltar sems can gyi khams bri ba dang / gang bar mi mngon pa bzhin du chos thams cad kyang bri ba'am gang bar mi mngon no // gang dag bri ba'am /
translated: Just as the realm of sentient beings is not seen to increase or decrease, so also all phenomena are not seen to increase or decrease.

original: gang bar 'gyur bar chos thams cad la yongs su grub pa gang yang med de /🔽gang gis de ltar chos thams cad khong du chud pa de ni /
analyzed: gang bar 'gyur bar chos thams cad la yongs su grub pa gang yang med de / gang gis de ltar chos thams cad khong du chud pa de ni /
translated: There is no establishment of any phenomenon whatsoever that would increase or decrease.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos khong du chud pa zhes bya ste /🔽ngas 'di la dgongs nas ji ltar sems can gyi khams bri ba'am /🔽gang bar mi mngon pa de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang bri ba'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos khong du chud pa zhes bya ste / ngas 'di la dgongs nas ji ltar sems can gyi khams bri ba'am / gang bar mi mngon pa de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang bri ba'am /
translated: Whoever understands all phenomena in this way is said to understand the qualities of a buddha.

original: gang bar mi mngon no //
analyzed: gang bar mi mngon no //
translated: With this in mind, I have said, ‘Just as the realm of sentient beings is not seen to increase or decrease, so also all phenomena are not seen to increase or decrease.

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //
translated: Thus it is explained.🔽🔽

original: gang yang yongs su ma grub pa'i tshul gyis chos thams cad bri ba ma yin /
analyzed: gang yang yongs su ma grub pa'i tshul gyis chos thams cad bri ba ma yin /
translated: Also, all phenomena are not seen to increase or decrease because they are not established in any way.

original: gang ba ma yin pa des sangs rgyas kyi chos kyang bri ba ma yin /
analyzed: gang ba ma yin pa des sangs rgyas kyi chos kyang bri ba ma yin /
translated: The Buddha’s teachings are neither diminished nor increased by that which is not full.

original: gang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang ba ma yin no //
translated: They are not full.

original: de ltar chos thams cad khong du chud pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams bri ba med cing gang ba med pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad khong du chud pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams bri ba med cing gang ba med pa'o //
translated: In this way, because all phenomena are fully understood, the Buddha’s teachings are neither diminished nor increased.

original: chos thams cad bri ba med cing gang ba med pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos zhes bya ba de ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad bri ba med cing gang ba med pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos zhes bya ba de ni /
translated: Because all phenomena are neither diminished nor increased, the so-called ‘Buddha’s teachings’

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi tshig bla dvags ma yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi tshig bla dvags ma yin no //
translated: are not a designation for the Buddha’s teachings.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ni /🔽gang gis kyang bri ba'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ni / gang gis kyang bri ba'am /
translated: The Buddha’s teachings

original: gang bar bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: gang bar bya bar mi nus so //
translated: cannot be diminished or increased by anyone.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ni / chos thams cad khong du chud pa'i phyir te /🔽gang chos @15b thams cad khong du chud pa de la bri ba'am /
analyzed: 'di ni / chos thams cad khong du chud pa'i phyir te / gang chos @15b thams cad khong du chud pa de la bri ba'am /
translated: Because all phenomena are fully understood.

original: gang ba'i chos ci yang med do //
analyzed: gang ba'i chos ci yang med do //
translated: For one who fully understands all phenomena, there is no phenomenon that is diminished or increased.

original: chos thams cad ces bya ba de ni /🔽chos kyi dbyings kyi tshig bla dvags te /
analyzed: chos thams cad ces bya ba de ni / chos kyi dbyings kyi tshig bla dvags te /
translated: What are called ‘all phenomena’🔽are a designation for the realm of phenomena.

original: chos kyi dbyings la ni /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la ni /
translated: In the realm of phenomena,

original: bri ba'am / gang ba med do; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: bri ba'am / gang ba med do; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: There is no increase or decrease. And why?

original: chos kyi dbyings ni /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni /
translated: Because the realm of phenomena

original: mtha' yas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtha' yas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is infinite.

original: sems can gyi khams dang / chos kyi dbyings ni /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams dang / chos kyi dbyings ni /
translated: The realm of sentient beings and the realm of phenomena

original: tha dad du mi dmigs so //
analyzed: tha dad du mi dmigs so //
translated: are not observed to be separate.

original: sems can gyi khams dang / chos kyi dbyings la bri ba'am /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams dang / chos kyi dbyings la bri ba'am /
translated: In the realm of sentient beings and the realm of phenomena,

original: gang ba dmigs pa'am yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang ba dmigs pa'am yod pa ma yin te /
translated: increase or decrease is not observed or found.

original: gang gis de ltar khong du chud pa de ni /
analyzed: gang gis de ltar khong du chud pa de ni /
translated: One who understands it in this way

original: byang chub ces bya'o //🔽de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams bri ba'am /
analyzed: byang chub ces bya'o // de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams bri ba'am /
translated: is said to be ‘enlightened.

original: gang bar mi mngon zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang bar mi mngon zhes bya'o //
translated: ’ Therefore, it is said that the qualities of the Buddha are not seen to increase or decrease.

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
translated: Subhūti,

original: bri ba med cing gang ba med pa zhes ji skad du smras pa de ni /
analyzed: bri ba med cing gang ba med pa zhes ji skad du smras pa de ni /
translated: what I have called ‘no increase and no decrease’

original: rtag pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba'i tshig bla dvags so //
analyzed: rtag pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba'i tshig bla dvags so //
translated: is a term for seeing the permanent as it is.

original: de la ni /🔽ci yang bsal ba'am /
analyzed: de la ni / ci yang bsal ba'am /
translated: In that regard,🔽nothing can be removed

original: gzhag par mi nus te /
analyzed: gzhag par mi nus te /
translated: or established.

original: gang de ltar khong du chud pa de ni /
analyzed: gang de ltar khong du chud pa de ni /
translated: One who understands it in this way

original: byang chub ces bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub ces bya'o //
translated: is said to be ‘enlightened.🔽’

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
translated: Subhūti,

original: byang chub ces bya ba de ni /
analyzed: byang chub ces bya ba de ni /
translated: “awakening”

original: sangs rgyas kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: is a defining characteristic of a buddha.

original: sangs rgyas kyi mtshan nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mtshan nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the defining characteristic of a buddha?

original: chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid mtshan nyid med pa de ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid mtshan nyid med pa de ni /
translated: The defining characteristic of all phenomena is the absence of defining characteristics.

original: sangs rgyas kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: That is the defining characteristic of a buddha.

original: byang chub ni /
analyzed: byang chub ni /
translated: Awakening

original: mtshan nyid med pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa ste /
translated: is without defining characteristics.

original: mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin las ldog pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin las ldog pa'o //
translated: It is the opposite of the nature of defining characteristics.

original: gang de ltar khong du chud pa de ni /
analyzed: gang de ltar khong du chud pa de ni /
translated: One who understands it in this way

original: byang chub ces bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub ces bya ste /
translated: is said to be “awakened.”

original: ji skad du brjod pa bzhin du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du brjod pa bzhin du ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not as it is expressed.

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
translated: Subhūti,

original: de ni / chos thams cad rjes su rtogs @16a *//
analyzed: de ni / chos thams cad rjes su rtogs @16a *//
translated: because of realizing all phenomena,

original: pas byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pas byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
translated: one is called a bodhisattva.

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /🔽gang la la zhig chos 'di rab tu mi shes /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa / gang la la zhig chos 'di rab tu mi shes /
translated: Subhūti,🔽if someone does not understand

original: khong du ma chud par bdag byang chub sems dpa' zhes khas 'che na /
analyzed: khong du ma chud par bdag byang chub sems dpa' zhes khas 'che na /
translated: and realize these phenomena, but claims, “I am a bodhisattva,”

original: de ni / byang chub sems dpa'i sa las ring ngo //
analyzed: de ni / byang chub sems dpa'i sa las ring ngo //
translated: It is far from the bodhisattva levels.

original: de ni / byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams las ring ngo //
analyzed: de ni / byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams las ring ngo //
translated: It is far from the bodhisattva qualities.

original: de ni / byang chub sems dpa'i ming gis lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten la slu ba'o //
analyzed: de ni / byang chub sems dpa'i ming gis lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten la slu ba'o //
translated: It is a deception for the world with its gods, humans, and asuras through the name ‘bodhisattva.’

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
translated: Suvikrāntavikrāmin,

original: gal te tshig tsam gyis byang chub sems dpar gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te tshig tsam gyis byang chub sems dpar gyur na ni /
translated: if one were to become a bodhisattva merely through words,

original: de'i phyir sems can thams cad kyang byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can thams cad kyang byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ro //
translated: then all sentient beings would be bodhisattvas.

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
translated: Suvikrāntavikrāmin,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa zhes bya ba de ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa zhes bya ba de ni /
translated: the so-called bodhisattva levels

original: tshig gi las tsam ma yin no //
analyzed: tshig gi las tsam ma yin no //
translated: are not merely verbal actions.

original: tshig gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: tshig gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus so //
translated: One cannot fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood through words.

original: tshig gi las kyis byang chub dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshig gi las kyis byang chub dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattva qualities and awakening are not attained through verbal actions.

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
translated: Subhūti,

original: sems can thams cad ni /
analyzed: sems can thams cad ni /
translated: all sentient beings

original: byang chub la spyod mod kyi /
analyzed: byang chub la spyod mod kyi /
translated: are engaged in awakening,

original: mi shes shing khong du ma chud de /
analyzed: mi shes shing khong du ma chud de /
translated: but they do not know it and do not understand it.

original: de'i phyir de dag byang chub sems dpa' zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag byang chub sems dpa' zhes mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are not called bodhisattvas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems can rnams sems can med par mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can rnams sems can med par mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because sentient beings do not know that sentient beings do not exist.

original: gal te de ltar shes na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar shes na /
translated: If they knew that,

original: bdag gi spyod pa dag gis byang chub sems dpa' dag tu 'gyur ba'i rigs @16b so;/
analyzed: bdag gi spyod pa dag gis byang chub sems dpa' dag tu 'gyur ba'i rigs @16b so;/
translated: it would be reasonable that they would become bodhisattvas through their own conduct.

original: sems can thams cad ni /
analyzed: sems can thams cad ni /
translated: All sentient beings

original: phyin ci log pas rang gi spyod pa dang / rang gi yul dang / rang gi spyod yul rab tu mi shes so //
analyzed: phyin ci log pas rang gi spyod pa dang / rang gi yul dang / rang gi spyod yul rab tu mi shes so //
translated: do not know their own conduct, their own domain, and their own sphere of activity because of error.

original: gal te rang gi spyod pa rab tu shes na ni /
analyzed: gal te rang gi spyod pa rab tu shes na ni /
translated: If they knew their own conduct,

original: de dag slar gang la yang rnam par rtog cing spyod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag slar gang la yang rnam par rtog cing spyod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: they would not engage in conceptual thought and conduct with regard to anything at all.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang / spyod pa de dag gis byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad yang dag pa ma yin pa la dmigs shing spyod kyang de dag byang chub la dmigs pa snyam du rlom sems su byed de /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang / spyod pa de dag gis byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad yang dag pa ma yin pa la dmigs shing spyod kyang de dag byang chub la dmigs pa snyam du rlom sems su byed de /
translated: “All childish ordinary beings, through these thoughts and actions, engage with and observe what is not real, and yet they imagine that they are observing and engaging with awakening.

original: dmigs pa la spyod cing rtog pa la spyod pa de dag la byang chub ga la yod /
analyzed: dmigs pa la spyod cing rtog pa la spyod pa de dag la byang chub ga la yod /
translated: How could there be awakening for those who engage with and observe objects?

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams ga la yod de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams ga la yod de /
translated: How could there be the qualities of a bodhisattva?

original: gang gi chos de lta bur rab tu shes pa de dag slar yang dag pa ma yin pa'i dmigs pa la mi spyod cing /🔽de dag ni /
analyzed: gang gi chos de lta bur rab tu shes pa de dag slar yang dag pa ma yin pa'i dmigs pa la mi spyod cing / de dag ni /
translated: Those who know the qualities in this way do not engage with and observe what is not real.

original: phyir chos gang yang rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: phyir chos gang yang rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: They do not imagine any phenomena.

original: de'i phyir spyod pa med pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir spyod pa med pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the absence of engagement

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa zhes bya'o; ;byang chub sems dpa' ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa zhes bya'o; ;byang chub sems dpa' ni /
translated: is called the bodhisattvas’ engagement.

original: rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa la mi spyod do //
analyzed: rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa la mi spyod do //
translated: Bodhisattvas do not engage with thoughts and concepts.

original: gang la rtog pa med pa de la spyod pa gang yang med do //
analyzed: gang la rtog pa med pa de la spyod pa gang yang med do //
translated: Where there are no thoughts, there is no engagement.

original: gang la rnam par rtog pa med pa de la spyod pa'i don gang yang med do //
analyzed: gang la rnam par rtog pa med pa de la spyod pa'i don gang yang med do //
translated: There is no object of activity for those who are nonconceptual.

original: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa thams cad ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa thams cad ni /
translated: The activity of all buddhas and bodhisattvas

original: rnam par mi rtog par spyod cing thams cad rlom sems med la dmigs pa dang bcas pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog par spyod cing thams cad rlom sems med la dmigs pa dang bcas pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: is nonconceptual activity. They are not conceited about anything, and they are not focused.

original: chos thams cad de ltar rab tu shes pa de ni /🔽phyir dmigs pa'am /🔽rnam par rtog pa la spyod pa'am /
analyzed: chos thams cad de ltar rab tu shes pa de ni / phyir dmigs pa'am / rnam par rtog pa la spyod pa'am /
translated: Those who know all phenomena in this way🔽do not engage in conceptualization or

original: rnam par spyod pa med de /🔽de ni / spyod pa med pa'i tshul gyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams @17a *//
analyzed: rnam par spyod pa med de / de ni / spyod pa med pa'i tshul gyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams @17a *//
translated: conceptual activity.🔽This is called the bodhisattvas’ activity,

original: kyi spyod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kyi spyod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: in the sense that it is nonactivity.

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
translated: Suvikrāntavikrāmin,

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: this is how

original: byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la spyod pa yin no //
translated: bodhisattvas engage in the bodhisattva activity.”

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
translated: Suvikrāntavikrāmin,

original: gang de ltar chos khong du chud cing rab tu rtogs pa de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang de ltar chos khong du chud cing rab tu rtogs pa de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
translated: Because they have realized and fully understood this, they are called bodhisattvas.

original: des sems can du 'du shes pa bsal bas sems can med pa zhes bya ba de ni /
analyzed: des sems can du 'du shes pa bsal bas sems can med pa zhes bya ba de ni /
translated: Because they have eliminated the notion of sentient beings, they are called ‘without sentient beings.’

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tshig bla dvags so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshig bla dvags so //
translated: This is a synonym for bodhisattva.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽des sems can thams cad yang dag pa ma yin pa dang / sems can thams cad sems can ma yin pa dang / sems can thams cad ni /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / des sems can thams cad yang dag pa ma yin pa dang / sems can thams cad sems can ma yin pa dang / sems can thams cad ni /
translated: Why is that?

original: phyin ci log gis sems can dang / sems can thams cad ni /
analyzed: phyin ci log gis sems can dang / sems can thams cad ni /
translated: Because they know that all sentient beings are unreal, that all sentient beings are not sentient beings, that all sentient beings are sentient beings due to error,

original: yongs su brtags pas sems can dang / sems can thams cad ni /
analyzed: yongs su brtags pas sems can dang / sems can thams cad ni /
translated: that all sentient beings are sentient beings due to imputation,

original: yod pa ma yin pa la dmigs pas sems can dang / sems can thams cad ni /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa la dmigs pas sems can dang / sems can thams cad ni /
translated: that all sentient beings are sentient beings due to observing what does not exist,

original: rang gi spyod pa rnam par ma rung par byas pas sems can dang / sems can thams cad ni /🔽ma rig pa 'du byed pas sems can no //
analyzed: rang gi spyod pa rnam par ma rung par byas pas sems can dang / sems can thams cad ni / ma rig pa 'du byed pas sems can no //
translated: that all sentient beings are sentient beings due to their own conduct being corrupted,

original: zhes shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and that all sentient beings are sentient beings due to ignorance creating formations.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems can thams cad ni /🔽chos gang dag med pa'i chos de dag mngon par 'du byed pas /🔽de'i phyir sems can thams cad ni /
analyzed: sems can thams cad ni / chos gang dag med pa'i chos de dag mngon par 'du byed pas / de'i phyir sems can thams cad ni /
translated: All sentient beings

original: ma rig pa 'du byed pas sems can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa 'du byed pas sems can zhes bya'o //
translated: are called sentient beings because they are conditioned by ignorance.

original: chos med pa gang zhe na /🔽nga zhe'am / nga'i zhe'am /
analyzed: chos med pa gang zhe na / nga zhe'am / nga'i zhe'am /
translated: What is the absence of phenomena?

original: nga'o // zhes bya ba'i chos gang yang med pa'o //🔽gal te chos 'ga' zhig nga zhe'am @17b nga'i zhe'am /
analyzed: nga'o // zhes bya ba'i chos gang yang med pa'o // gal te chos 'ga' zhig nga zhe'am @17b nga'i zhe'am /
translated: There is no phenomenon whatsoever that is called ‘I,’ ‘mine,’🔽or ‘I am.’🔽If there were any phenomenon that was called ‘I,’ ‘mine,’

original: nga'o // zhes bya bar gyur na /
analyzed: nga'o // zhes bya bar gyur na /
translated: or ‘I am,’

original: de'i phyir sems can thams cad yang dag par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can thams cad yang dag par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: then all sentient beings would be real.

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /🔽'di ltar nga zhe'am /🔽nga'i zhe'am / nga'o //
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa / 'di ltar nga zhe'am / nga'i zhe'am / nga'o //
translated: Suvikrāntavikrāmin,🔽there is no phenomenon whatsoever that is called ‘I,’

original: zhes bya ba'i chos gang yang med pas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i chos gang yang med pas /
translated: ‘mine,’ or ‘I am.’

original: de'i phyir sems can ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can ni /
translated: Therefore, sentient beings

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: are not real.

original: sems can thams cad ni /
analyzed: sems can thams cad ni /
translated: All sentient beings

original: ma rig pa 'du byed pas sems can thams cad ces bya'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa 'du byed pas sems can thams cad ces bya'o //
translated: are called sentient beings because they are conditioned by ignorance.

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /🔽gang la yang nga zhe'am /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa / gang la yang nga zhe'am /
translated: there is no phenomenon called ‘sentient being’

original: nga'i zhe'am / nga'o //🔽zhes bya ba'i sems can zhes bya ba'i chos gang yang med de /
analyzed: nga'i zhe'am / nga'o // zhes bya ba'i sems can zhes bya ba'i chos gang yang med de /
translated: that could be called ‘I’ or ‘mine’ or ‘my self.’

original: gang gi phyir med pa de'i phyir sems can ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir med pa de'i phyir sems can ni /
translated: Because it does not exist, a sentient being🔽is said to be unreal.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa zhes bya'o //🔽yang dag pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba de ni /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa zhes bya'o // yang dag pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba de ni /
translated: ‘Unreal’

original: sems can med pa'i tshig bla dvags so //🔽ji ltar sems can du 'du shes pa yang dag pa ma yin pa la mngon par zhen pa de ltar sems can rnams yang dag pa ma yin pa zhes bya'o //🔽rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /🔽yang dag pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba de la ni /🔽yang dag pa ci yang med cing ma byung ba'o //🔽chos thams cad kyang yang dag pa ma yin zhing ma byung ba'o //
analyzed: sems can med pa'i tshig bla dvags so // ji ltar sems can du 'du shes pa yang dag pa ma yin pa la mngon par zhen pa de ltar sems can rnams yang dag pa ma yin pa zhes bya'o // rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa / yang dag pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba de la ni / yang dag pa ci yang med cing ma byung ba'o // chos thams cad kyang yang dag pa ma yin zhing ma byung ba'o //
translated: is a synonym for ‘nonexistent sentient being.’

original: de la sems can yang dag pa ma yin pa la lhag par chags pa de ni /
analyzed: de la sems can yang dag pa ma yin pa la lhag par chags pa de ni /
translated: Sentient beings are said to be unreal in the sense that they are unreal, in the sense that they are not real, in the sense that they are not true, in the sense that they are not existent, in the sense that they are not established, in the sense that they are not permanent, in the sense that they are not eternal, in the sense that they are not unchanging, in the sense that they are not unmoving, in the sense that they are not unarisen, in the sense that they are not nonexistent, in the sense that they are not nonabiding, in the sense that they are not nonperishing, in the sense that they are not nondefiled, in the sense that they are not nonpurified, in the sense that they are not nonarisen, in the sense that they are not nonceased, in the sense that they are not nonempty, in the sense that they are not signless, in the sense that they are not wishless, in the sense that they are not non-fully-perfected, in the sense that they are not nonconditioned, in the sense that they are not nonarisen, in the sense that they are not nonceased, in the sense that they are not nondefiled, in the sense that they are not nonpurified, in the sense that they are not nonarisen, in the sense that they are not nonceased, in the sense that they are not nonempty, in the sense that they are not signless, in the sense that they are not wishless, in the sense that they are not non-fully-perfected, in the sense that they are not nonconditioned, in the sense that they are not nonarisen, in the sense that they are not nonceased, in the sense that they are not nondefiled, in the sense that they are not nonpurified, in the sense that they are not nonarisen, in the sense that they are not nonceased, in the sense that they are not nonempty, in the sense that they are not signless, in the sense that they are not wishless, in the sense that they are

original: rnam par 'ching ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par 'ching ba ste /
translated: It is a fetter.

original: de'i phyir yang dag pa ma yin pa la dmigs pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang dag pa ma yin pa la dmigs pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the observation of what is not real

original: sems can zhes bya'o; ;de dag ni /
analyzed: sems can zhes bya'o; ;de dag ni /
translated: is called ‘sentient beings.’

original: spyod pa gang khong du chud pas byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i rang gi spyod pa de mi shes te /🔽yongs su ma rtogs pas sems can ni /
analyzed: spyod pa gang khong du chud pas byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i rang gi spyod pa de mi shes te / yongs su ma rtogs pas sems can ni /
translated: They do not know their own conduct, which is the conduct through which one is called a bodhisattva and which they have not understood.🔽Therefore, sentient beings are called ‘not real.’

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa zhes bya'o //🔽rab @18a *// kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa zhes bya'o // rab @18a *// kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
translated: “Subhūti,

original: gang de ltar chos khong du chud pa de ni /
analyzed: gang de ltar chos khong du chud pa de ni /
translated: one who understands the Dharma in that way

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
translated: is called a bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba de ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba de ni /
translated: ‘Bodhisattva’ is a designation

original: gang gis chos thams cad khong du chud cing shes la /
analyzed: gang gis chos thams cad khong du chud cing shes la /
translated: for one who understands and knows all phenomena

original: sems can rjes su rtogs pa'i tshig bla dvags so //
analyzed: sems can rjes su rtogs pa'i tshig bla dvags so //
translated: and realizes sentient beings.

original: ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How is it known?

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa dang / ma byung ba dang / phyin ci log ma yin par ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa dang / ma byung ba dang / phyin ci log ma yin par ro //
translated: It is known to be unreal, non-arisen, and not mistaken.

original: ji ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo dag gis brtags pa de dag ni /
analyzed: ji ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo dag gis brtags pa de dag ni /
translated: What is imagined by foolish, ordinary beings🔽is not real.

original: de bzhin du ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du ma yin no //
translated: It is not like that.

original: ji ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo dag gis rnyed pa de dag de bzhin du ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo dag gis rnyed pa de dag de bzhin du ma yin te /
translated: It is not like the way that foolish, ordinary beings acquire it.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the ‘enlightenment of the bodhisattvas.’

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: byang chub ni /
analyzed: byang chub ni /
translated: Enlightenment

original: ma brtags / rnam par ma brtags shing /
analyzed: ma brtags / rnam par ma brtags shing /
translated: is not examined or analyzed.

original: byang chub ni /
analyzed: byang chub ni /
translated: Enlightenment

original: rnam par ma bsgrubs la mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par ma bsgrubs la mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is not accomplished and is not observed.

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
translated: Su­vikrānta­vikrāmiṇ,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas ni /
translated: the Tathāgata

original: byang chub ma brnyes so //
analyzed: byang chub ma brnyes so //
translated: has not attained enlightenment.

original: chos thams cad mi rnyed cing chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i phyir byang chub ces bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad mi rnyed cing chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i phyir byang chub ces bya'o //
translated: Enlightenment is called ‘enlightenment’ because all phenomena are not attained and all phenomena are not observed.

original: de lta bu ni /
analyzed: de lta bu ni /
translated: That is

original: sangs rgyas kyi byang chub ces bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi byang chub ces bya ste /
translated: called the ‘enlightenment of the buddhas,’

original: ji skad du brjod pa bzhin du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du brjod pa bzhin du ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not as it is described.

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
translated: Su­vikrānta­vikrāmiṇ,

original: gang dag byang chub kyi phyir sems 'di bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag byang chub kyi phyir sems 'di bskyed par bya'o //
translated: those who think, ‘I will generate this mind for enlightenment’

original: zhes byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / gang du bdag gis sems bskyed par bya ba'i byang chub de yod do //
analyzed: zhes byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / gang du bdag gis sems bskyed par bya ba'i byang chub de yod do //
translated: Thus, they generate the thought of awakening, and they think, “I will generate the thought of awakening, and that awakening exists.”

original: zhes byang chub rlom sems su byed pa de dag ni /
analyzed: zhes byang chub rlom sems su byed pa de dag ni /
translated: Thus, they make awakening into something that is imagined.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes mi bya ste /🔽de dag ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes mi bya ste / de dag ni /
translated: They are not called bodhisattvas.

original: sems @18b can bskyed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems @18b can bskyed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called “those who generate the thought of a sentient being.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di ltar / de dag ni /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar / de dag ni /
translated: Why is that?

original: skye bar mngon par zhen cing sems su mngon par zhen nas byang chub la mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye bar mngon par zhen cing sems su mngon par zhen nas byang chub la mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are attached to birth, attached to the thought, and attached to awakening.

original: gang dag byang chub kyi phyir sems bskyed pa de dag ni /
analyzed: gang dag byang chub kyi phyir sems bskyed pa de dag ni /
translated: Those who generate the thought of awakening for the sake of awakening

original: byang chub kyi sems la mngon par zhen pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems la mngon par zhen pa zhes bya'o //
translated: are called “those who are attached to the thought of awakening.”

original: gang gi phyir mngon par 'du byed pa de'i phyir byang chub tu sems bskyed de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mngon par 'du byed pa de'i phyir byang chub tu sems bskyed de /
translated: Because they form something, they generate the thought of awakening.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: mngon par 'du byed ni /
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed ni /
translated: forming something

original: sems can zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems can zhes bya ste /
translated: is called “a sentient being.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ma yin no //
translated: It is not a bodhisattva.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽de dag ni /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽de dag ni /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems can skyes pa zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can skyes pa zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because sentient beings are said to be born.

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
translated: Suvikrāntavikrāmin,

original: byang chub ni /
analyzed: byang chub ni /
translated: awakening

original: ma skyes shing /🔽byang chub ni /
analyzed: ma skyes shing / byang chub ni /
translated: is unborn.🔽Suvikrāntavikrāmin,

original: bsam du med pas byang chub kyi phyir sems par mi nus so //
analyzed: bsam du med pas byang chub kyi phyir sems par mi nus so //
translated: awakening is inconceivable, and so it is not possible to think about awakening.

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
translated: Suvikrāntavikrāmin,

original: de dag skye ba nyid la mngon par zhen kyang de dag skye ba rab tu mi shes so //
analyzed: de dag skye ba nyid la mngon par zhen kyang de dag skye ba rab tu mi shes so //
translated: although they are fixated on birth itself, they do not understand birth.

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
translated: Suvikrāntavikrāmin,

original: skye ba mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: skye ba mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa de ni /
translated: the sameness of birth

original: yang dag pa nyid do //
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid do //
translated: is reality.

original: sems mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa dang / yang dag pa nyid gang yin pa dang / mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa dang / yang dag pa nyid de ni /
analyzed: sems mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa dang / yang dag pa nyid gang yin pa dang / mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa dang / yang dag pa nyid de ni /
translated: The sameness of mind, reality, sameness, and the real

original: byang chub ste /
analyzed: byang chub ste /
translated: is awakening.

original: gang na yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid yod pa de na rnam par rtog pa gang yang med na /
analyzed: gang na yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid yod pa de na rnam par rtog pa gang yang med na /
translated: Wherever there is reality just as it is, there is no conceptualization whatsoever.

original: de dag ni /
analyzed: de dag ni /
translated: They

original: sems dang / byang chub la rnam par brtags te /
analyzed: sems dang / byang chub la rnam par brtags te /
translated: conceptualize mind and awakening.

original: gnyis su mngon par zhen nas byang chub kyi phyir sems bskyed do //
analyzed: gnyis su mngon par zhen nas byang chub kyi phyir sems bskyed do //
translated: They generate the mind of awakening for the sake of awakening, fixated on duality.

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
translated: Suvikrāntavikrāmin,

original: sems kyang gzhan ma yin /
analyzed: sems kyang gzhan ma yin /
translated: the mind is not one thing,

original: byang chub kyang gzhan ma yin /
analyzed: byang chub kyang gzhan ma yin /
translated: and awakening another.

original: sems la byang chub med /🔽byang chub la yang @19a *//
analyzed: sems la byang chub med / byang chub la yang @19a *//
translated: The mind is not awakening,

original: sems med de /
analyzed: sems med de /
translated: and awakening is not the mind.

original: byang chub gang yin pa dang / sems gang yin pa de ni yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid dang / ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: byang chub gang yin pa dang / sems gang yin pa de ni yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid dang / ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: Awakening is the mind’s suchness and the way things are.

original: de la ni byang chub kyang med /
analyzed: de la ni byang chub kyang med /
translated: There is no awakening in that,

original: sems kyang med do //
analyzed: sems kyang med do //
translated: and there is no mind.

original: gang gis sems nyid dang / byang chub dang / skye ba dang / mi skye ba yang mi dmigs pa de byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis sems nyid dang / byang chub dang / skye ba dang / mi skye ba yang mi dmigs pa de byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
translated: One who does not observe the mind, awakening, origination, or non-origination is called a bodhisattva.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
translated: One is called a bodhisattva who is the suchness of the mind.

original: sems dpa' chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: One is called a great being.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: des gang dang gang la des yang dag pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des gang dang gang la des yang dag pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they know what is not real in all things.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is not real?

original: 'jig rten thams cad ni yang dag pa ma yin pa ste; yang dag pa ma yin par rtogs so //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad ni yang dag pa ma yin pa ste; yang dag pa ma yin par rtogs so //
translated: The entire world is not real.

original: kye ma 'jig rten gnas pa 'di ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: kye ma 'jig rten gnas pa 'di ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Alas, the world is not real.

original: ma byung ba'o //
analyzed: ma byung ba'o //
translated: It is not arisen.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa /
translated: It is not real.🔽It is not arisen.

original: mi 'byung ba zhes bya zhe na yang dag pa ma yin pa la 'byung ba gang yang med de /
analyzed: mi 'byung ba zhes bya zhe na yang dag pa ma yin pa la 'byung ba gang yang med de /
translated: What is not real does not arise at all.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa ni mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa ni mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: What is not real does not arise.

original: de'i phyir chos thams cad ni ngo bo nyid kyis med pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos thams cad ni ngo bo nyid kyis med pa /
translated: Therefore, all phenomena are said to be essentially nonexistent

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and not real.

original: gang gis de ltar shes pa de ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi sems can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis de ltar shes pa de ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi sems can zhes bya'o //
translated: One who knows this is said to be a being who is real just as he appears.

original: yang dag pa la yang dag pa zhes mngon par mi zhen pas de'i phyir yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi sems can zhes bya ste ji skad du brjod pa bzhin du ma yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa la yang dag pa zhes mngon par mi zhen pas de'i phyir yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi sems can zhes bya ste ji skad du brjod pa bzhin du ma yin no //
translated: Because he does not cling to what is real as real, he is said to be a being who is real just as he appears, but not just as he is described.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽yang dag pa ma yin pa la sems can nam /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / yang dag pa ma yin pa la sems can nam /
translated: Why is this?

original: sems can chen po zhes bya ba gang yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can chen po zhes bya ba gang yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there are no sentient beings or great sentient beings in what is not real.

original: gang gis theg pa chen po khong @19b du chud pa de sems can chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis theg pa chen po khong @19b du chud pa de sems can chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: One who has understood the Great Vehicle is called a great sentient being.

original: theg pa chen po gang zhe na /
analyzed: theg pa chen po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the Great Vehicle?

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ni theg pa chen po'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ni theg pa chen po'o //
translated: The wisdom of omniscience is the Great Vehicle.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes gang zhe na /🔽gang ci yang rung ste /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes gang zhe na / gang ci yang rung ste /
translated: What is the wisdom of omniscience?

original: 'dus byas shes pa dang / 'dus ma byas shes pa dang / 'jig rten shes pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa shes pa des sems can chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas shes pa dang / 'dus ma byas shes pa dang / 'jig rten shes pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa shes pa des sems can chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of the conditioned, the knowledge of the unconditioned, the knowledge of the world, and the knowledge beyond the world.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: de sems can du 'du shes pa chen po med pas /
analyzed: de sems can du 'du shes pa chen po med pas /
translated: Because there is no great perception of sentient beings.

original: de'i phyir sems can chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the great sentient being.

original: de la ma rig pa'i phung po chen po med pas /
analyzed: de la ma rig pa'i phung po chen po med pas /
translated: Because there is no great mass of ignorance,

original: de'i phyir sems can chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: it is called the great sentient being.

original: de la 'du byed kyi phung po med pas /
analyzed: de la 'du byed kyi phung po med pas /
translated: Since there is no aggregate of formation,

original: de'i phyir sems can chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: it is called the great being.

original: de la mi shes pa'i phung po chen po med pas /
analyzed: de la mi shes pa'i phung po chen po med pas /
translated: Since there is no great aggregate of ignorance,

original: de'i phyir sems can chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: it is called the great being.

original: de la sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po med pas /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po med pas /
translated: Since there is no great aggregate of suffering,

original: de'i phyir sems can chen po zhes bya'o //🔽rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can chen po zhes bya'o // rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
translated: it is called the great being.🔽“Subhūti,

original: gang dag sems dpa' chen po'i 'du shes la yang smod la /
analyzed: gang dag sems dpa' chen po'i 'du shes la yang smod la /
translated: those who disparage the perception of a great being

original: sems kyang mi dmigs /
analyzed: sems kyang mi dmigs /
translated: and do not apprehend the mind,

original: sems las byung ba'i chos dang / sems kyi rang bzhin yang rab tu mi shes /
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i chos dang / sems kyi rang bzhin yang rab tu mi shes /
translated: do not understand the nature of the mind and mental phenomena,

original: byang chub kyang mi dmigs /
analyzed: byang chub kyang mi dmigs /
translated: do not apprehend awakening,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / byang chub kyi rang bzhin yang rab tu mi shes te /🔽de dag mi shes pa'i sems kyis byang chub kyang mi mthong /🔽byang chub ma gtogs par sems kyang mi mthong /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / byang chub kyi rang bzhin yang rab tu mi shes te / de dag mi shes pa'i sems kyis byang chub kyang mi mthong / byang chub ma gtogs par sems kyang mi mthong /
translated: and do not understand the nature of the qualities that contribute to awakening,🔽with a mind that does not understand, do not see awakening,🔽do not see the mind apart from awakening,

original: byang chub la sems mi mthong /
analyzed: byang chub la sems mi mthong /
translated: and do not see the mind in awakening.

original: sems la byang chub mi mthong ste /
analyzed: sems la byang chub mi mthong ste /
translated: The mind does not see awakening.

original: gang de ltar rnam par 'jig pa de ni sgom pa yang med /🔽rnam par @20a *//
analyzed: gang de ltar rnam par 'jig pa de ni sgom pa yang med / rnam par @20a *//
translated: Those who thus destroy do not meditate,

original: 'jig par byed pa yang med de /
analyzed: 'jig par byed pa yang med de /
translated: and they do not destroy.

original: de rnam par 'jig par byed pa de yang mi dmigs shing rlom sems su mi byed pa /🔽mngon par zhen pa de dag byang chub tu sems bskyed do; ;rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
analyzed: de rnam par 'jig par byed pa de yang mi dmigs shing rlom sems su mi byed pa / mngon par zhen pa de dag byang chub tu sems bskyed do; ;rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
translated: They do not observe that which is to be destroyed, and they do not think highly of it.🔽They give rise to the mind of awakening in order to cling to it.

original: gang de ltar byang chub tu sems bskyed pa de dag ni /
analyzed: gang de ltar byang chub tu sems bskyed pa de dag ni /
translated: Suvikrāntavikrāmin, those who give rise to the mind of awakening in that way

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang dag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang dag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: are called ‘true bodhisattvas.’

original: de dag byang chub las phyir mi ldog go /
analyzed: de dag byang chub las phyir mi ldog go /
translated: They do not turn away from awakening.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: gang dag 'di ltar byang chub dang / sems dang / skye ba dang / 'gog pa tha dad du bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba de dag byang chub nyid la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: gang dag 'di ltar byang chub dang / sems dang / skye ba dang / 'gog pa tha dad du bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba de dag byang chub nyid la gnas pa ste /
translated: Those who do not see awakening, the mind, arising, and cessation as separate will abide in awakening itself.

original: 'di ni / gang yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'di ni / gang yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not see anything at all.

original: gang la yang mngon par mi zhe na /
analyzed: gang la yang mngon par mi zhe na /
translated: They do not crave anything at all.

original: gang la yang rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang la yang rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur te /
translated: They do not conceptualize anything at all.

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
translated: Suvikrāntavikrāmin,

original: gang dag de ltar rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol bar sems mi bskyed pa de dag ni /
analyzed: gang dag de ltar rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol bar sems mi bskyed pa de dag ni /
translated: those who are liberated in that way and do not give rise to the thought of liberation

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: are called ‘true bodhisattvas.’

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /🔽gang dag sems can du 'du shes pa dang / byang chub tu 'du shes pa dang / byang chub kyi phyir sems bskyed na /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa / gang dag sems can du 'du shes pa dang / byang chub tu 'du shes pa dang / byang chub kyi phyir sems bskyed na /
translated: Suvikrāntavikrāmin,

original: de dag ni /
analyzed: de dag ni /
translated: those who perceive sentient beings, perceive awakening, and give rise to the mind of awakening🔽are far from

original: byang chub las ring ba ste /
analyzed: byang chub las ring ba ste /
translated: awakening.

original: de ni / byang chub dang nye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni / byang chub dang nye ba ma yin no //
translated: They are not close to awakening.

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /🔽gang dag byang chub las ring ba'am /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa / gang dag byang chub las ring ba'am /
translated: Suvikrāntavikrāmin,🔽those who do not see awakening as far or near

original: nye bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba de dag byang chub dang nye ba ste /
analyzed: nye bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba de dag byang chub dang nye ba ste /
translated: are close to awakening.

original: de ni / byang chub kyi phyir sems bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: de ni / byang chub kyi phyir sems bskyed pa'o //
translated: That is the giving rise to the mind of awakening.

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
translated: Subhūti,

original: @20b ngas de la dgongs nas gang bdag gnyis su med par shes pa de ni /
analyzed: @20b ngas de la dgongs nas gang bdag gnyis su med par shes pa de ni /
translated: I have taught that those who understand the nonduality of the two selves

original: sangs rgyas dang / chos kyang rab tu shes so //🔽zhes bshad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / chos kyang rab tu shes so // zhes bshad do //
translated: understand the Buddha and the Dharma.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gnyis su med par yongs su shes pas chos thams cad yongs su shes te /
analyzed: gnyis su med par yongs su shes pas chos thams cad yongs su shes te /
translated: Because by understanding nonduality, all phenomena are understood.

original: de chos thams cad kyi bdag gi ngo bo nyid bsgoms pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de chos thams cad kyi bdag gi ngo bo nyid bsgoms pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they meditate on the intrinsic nature of all phenomena.

original: gang gnyis su med pa'i chos shes pa de ni /
analyzed: gang gnyis su med pa'i chos shes pa de ni /
translated: Those who understand nondual phenomena

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos shes pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos shes pa ste /
translated: understand the qualities of the Buddha.

original: chos gnyis su med par yongs su shes pas sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su shes so //
analyzed: chos gnyis su med par yongs su shes pas sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su shes so //
translated: By understanding the nonduality of phenomena, they understand the qualities of the Buddha.

original: bdag yongs su shes pas khams gsum thams cad yongs su shes so //
analyzed: bdag yongs su shes pas khams gsum thams cad yongs su shes so //
translated: By understanding the self, they understand the entire three realms.

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
translated: Subhūti,

original: gang dag yongs su shes pa zhes bya ba de ni /
analyzed: gang dag yongs su shes pa zhes bya ba de ni /
translated: what is called ‘understanding’

original: chos thams cad kyi pha rol lo //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi pha rol lo //
translated: is the other shore of all phenomena.

original: chos thams cad kyi pha rol yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi pha rol yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is the other shore of all phenomena?

original: gang pha rol nyid kyang mi dmigs /
analyzed: gang pha rol nyid kyang mi dmigs /
translated: The other shore is not perceived.🔽One should not be conceited about the other shore.

original: pha rol tu rlom sems su mi byed /🔽pha rol la mngon par mi zhen pa de ni /
analyzed: pha rol tu rlom sems su mi byed / pha rol la mngon par mi zhen pa de ni /
translated: One should not be attached to the other shore.

original: yongs su shes pas pha rol tu song ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yongs su shes pas pha rol tu song ba zhes bya ste /
translated: One who has gone to the other shore through complete understanding is called one who has gone to the other shore.

original: ji skad du brjod pa bzhin du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du brjod pa bzhin du ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not as it is expressed.

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /🔽de ltar 'di ni /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa / de ltar 'di ni /
translated: Suvikrāntavikrāmin,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: this is the bodhisattva level.

original: gang la shes par bya ba dang / rtogs par bya ba phra rab tsam yang med pa de ni /
analyzed: gang la shes par bya ba dang / rtogs par bya ba phra rab tsam yang med pa de ni /
translated: It should be known that there is not even the slightest thing to be known or realized.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /🔽de la ni; 'ong ba'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste / de la ni; 'ong ba'am /
translated: This is the bodhisattva’s perfection of wisdom.

original: 'gro ba mi mngon no //🔽gleng gzhi'i le'u zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba mi mngon no // gleng gzhi'i le'u zhes bya ste /
translated: In it, coming and going are not apparent.

original: dang po'o //// bam po gnyis pa /
analyzed: dang po'o //// bam po gnyis pa /
translated: This is the first chapter, “The Introduction.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos 'di @21a *//🔽skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos 'di @21a *// skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Ānanda said this to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: nga rgyal can mtshan ma la spyod pa rnams bstan pa 'di la skrag par 'gyur lags so //
analyzed: nga rgyal can mtshan ma la spyod pa rnams bstan pa 'di la skrag par 'gyur lags so //
translated: Those who are proud and who practice signs will be frightened by this teaching.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the venerable Śāradvatīputra said to the venerable Ānanda:

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo /
translated: “Venerable Ānanda,

original: 'di ni / nga rgyal can rnams kyi yul ma yin /
analyzed: 'di ni / nga rgyal can rnams kyi yul ma yin /
translated: this is not the domain of the proud.

original: rtogs pa ma yin pas de dag 'di la skrag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa ma yin pas de dag 'di la skrag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who are not realized will not be frightened by this.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang sdig pa'i grogs po'i lag tu song ba de dag ni /
analyzed: gang sdig pa'i grogs po'i lag tu song ba de dag ni /
translated: Those who have fallen into the hands of evil companions

original: 'di la skrag par gyur zin pas /
analyzed: 'di la skrag par gyur zin pas /
translated: have already been frightened by this.

original: 'di ni / de dag gi yul ma yin zhing mi rtogs so //
analyzed: 'di ni / de dag gi yul ma yin zhing mi rtogs so //
translated: This is not their domain, and they do not understand it.

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo /🔽gang dag nga rgyal spang ba'i phyir zhugs shing /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo / gang dag nga rgyal spang ba'i phyir zhugs shing /
translated: Venerable Ānanda,🔽those who have set out to abandon pride

original: nga rgyal spang ba'i phyir brtson pa de dag ni /
analyzed: nga rgyal spang ba'i phyir brtson pa de dag ni /
translated: and who strive to abandon pride

original: 'di la skrag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di la skrag par 'gyur ro //
translated: will be frightened by this.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nga rgyal yongs su shes pas nga rgyal med pa tshol zhing nga rgyal spong ba tshol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nga rgyal yongs su shes pas nga rgyal med pa tshol zhing nga rgyal spong ba tshol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they seek the absence of pride through the complete understanding of pride, and they seek the abandonment of pride.

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo /
translated: Venerable Ānanda,

original: gang dag nga rgyal mi dmigs shing /
analyzed: gang dag nga rgyal mi dmigs shing /
translated: those who do not apprehend pride,

original: yang dag par mi mthong la /
analyzed: yang dag par mi mthong la /
translated: who do not see it as real,

original: rlom sems su mi byed cing /
analyzed: rlom sems su mi byed cing /
translated: who do not think about it,

original: mngon par mi zhen pa de dag ni /🔽gang la yang mi skrag /🔽gang la yang mi dngangs /
analyzed: mngon par mi zhen pa de dag ni / gang la yang mi skrag / gang la yang mi dngangs /
translated: and who do not become fixated on it🔽will not be afraid of anything,🔽will not be terrified of anything,

original: gang la yang dngang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang la yang dngang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and will not be terrified by anything.

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo /
translated: Venerable Ānanda,

original: nga rgyal can rnams kyi phyir chos bstan pa 'di zhugs pa ma yin no; ;tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo /
analyzed: nga rgyal can rnams kyi phyir chos bstan pa 'di zhugs pa ma yin no; ;tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo /
translated: this teaching is not for the proud.🔽Venerable Ānanda,

original: 'di ni / nga rgyal can rnams kyi yul ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni / nga rgyal can rnams kyi yul ma yin te /
translated: this is not the domain of the proud;

original: go skabs med do //
analyzed: go skabs med do //
translated: there is no opportunity for them.

original: gang dag nga rgyal spang ba'i phyir brtson zhing 'bad pa de dag ni /
analyzed: gang dag nga rgyal spang ba'i phyir brtson zhing 'bad pa de dag ni /
translated: Those who strive and exert themselves in order to abandon pride

original: yang dag par 'bad @21b pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par 'bad @21b pa ma yin no //
translated: are not striving correctly.

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo /
translated: Venerable Ānanda,

original: nga rgyal zhes bya ba de ni /
analyzed: nga rgyal zhes bya ba de ni /
translated: what is called ‘pride’

original: lhag par byed pa sgro 'dogs pa'i tshig bla dvags so //
analyzed: lhag par byed pa sgro 'dogs pa'i tshig bla dvags so //
translated: In particular, they are words that exaggerate and overstate.

original: gang dag nga rgyal la spyod cing lhag par byed pa sgro 'dogs par byed pa de dag ni /
analyzed: gang dag nga rgyal la spyod cing lhag par byed pa sgro 'dogs par byed pa de dag ni /
translated: Those who engage in pride and exaggerate and overstate

original: mtshungs par mi spyod do //
analyzed: mtshungs par mi spyod do //
translated: do not engage in this Dharma.

original: mtshungs par spyod pa yang chos 'di la the tshom za'o //
analyzed: mtshungs par spyod pa yang chos 'di la the tshom za'o //
translated: Those who engage in this Dharma have doubts about it.

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo /
translated: Venerable Ānanda,

original: gang dag mnyam pa yang mi dmigs /
analyzed: gang dag mnyam pa yang mi dmigs /
translated: those who do not apprehend sameness

original: mi mnyam pa yang ma yin /🔽mnyam par yang rlom sems mi byed /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa yang ma yin / mnyam par yang rlom sems mi byed /
translated: and do not apprehend difference,🔽who do not think in terms of sameness

original: mi mnyam par yang ma yin /🔽mnyam par yang mi zhe na /
analyzed: mi mnyam par yang ma yin / mnyam par yang mi zhe na /
translated: and do not think in terms of difference,🔽who do not wish for sameness

original: mi mnyam par yang ma yin pa de dag ni /🔽gang la yang mi skrag /
analyzed: mi mnyam par yang ma yin pa de dag ni / gang la yang mi skrag /
translated: and do not wish for difference,🔽will not be afraid,🔽terrified, or trembling

original: mi dngangs / dngang par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi dngangs / dngang par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: with regard to anything.

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo /
translated: Venerable Ānanda,

original: 'di ni / byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad kyi yul ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni / byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad kyi yul ma yin te /
translated: this is not the domain of all foolish ordinary beings;

original: mi rtogs so //
analyzed: mi rtogs so //
translated: they do not understand it.

original: tshe dang ldan kun dga' bo /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan kun dga' bo /
translated: Venerable Ānanda,

original: 'di ni / byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad kyis shes shing rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni / byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad kyis shes shing rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not understood by any foolish ordinary person.

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo /
translated: Venerable Ānanda,

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa can rnams kyis kyang mi rtogs so //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa can rnams kyis kyang mi rtogs so //
translated: it is not understood by those in the Śrāvaka Vehicle.🔽Venerable Ānanda,

original: 'di ni / gang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa can chos zab mo la spyod pa de dag gis kyang mi rtogs so //
analyzed: 'di ni / gang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa can chos zab mo la spyod pa de dag gis kyang mi rtogs so //
translated: it is not understood by those in the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle who practice the profound Dharma.

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo /
translated: Venerable Ānanda,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa can gang dag mtshan ma la spyod pa dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su ma zin pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa can gang dag mtshan ma la spyod pa dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su ma zin pa /
translated: those in the Bodhisattva Vehicle who practice with signs, who are not taken care of by a spiritual friend,

original: sdig pa'i grogs po'i lag tu song ba de dag kyang chags pa med pa'i chos 'di dag mi rtogs shing yul ma yin te /
analyzed: sdig pa'i grogs po'i lag tu song ba de dag kyang chags pa med pa'i chos 'di dag mi rtogs shing yul ma yin te /
translated: who have fallen into the hands of bad friends, they do not understand these unattached dharmas, they are not the domain of

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo /
translated: Venerable Ānanda,

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa can bden pa mthong ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa ca @22a *//
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa can bden pa mthong ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa ca @22a *//
translated: those in the Śrāvaka Vehicle who have seen the truth, and those in the Bodhisattva Vehicle

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bstan pa /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bstan pa /
translated: who are taught by a spiritual friend,

original: chos zab mo la mos pa /
analyzed: chos zab mo la mos pa /
translated: They are devoted to the profound Dharma.

original: gang chos 'di dag la mthun par spyod pa dang / gang chos 'di khong du chud cing spyod pa rnams ni /
analyzed: gang chos 'di dag la mthun par spyod pa dang / gang chos 'di khong du chud cing spyod pa rnams ni /
translated: Those who practice in accordance with these teachings and those who understand and practice these teachings

original: ma gtogs so //
analyzed: ma gtogs so //
translated: are the exceptions.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: byang chub sems dpa' mtshan ma dang bral ba /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mtshan ma dang bral ba /
translated: bodhisattvas who are free from characteristics,

original: mtshan ma med pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa la spyod pa /
translated: who practice without characteristics,

original: sna tshogs med pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: sna tshogs med pa la spyod pa /
translated: who practice without variety,

original: zab mo'i chos shin tu mthar phyin pa /
analyzed: zab mo'i chos shin tu mthar phyin pa /

analyzed: rang gi gnas na rab tu dga' bar yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i char gyi chu chen po 'bebs so //

analyzed: de'i bur gyur pa de dag kyang rab tu dga' nas rang rang gi gnas na @23a *//

analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga 'byor cing ldan par gyur te rtse zhing char chen po 'bebs so //

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /

analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang chos kyi char chen po 'bebs so // gang 'di sras thu bo byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag kyang 'jig rten gyi khams 'di nas rang rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing du song ste chos kun 'byung ba 'di la brtsams nas de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi spyan sngar chos kyi
translated: In the same way, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One sends down a great rain of Dharma.

original: char chen po gtong zhing chos kyi char chen po rab tu 'bebs so //
analyzed: char chen po gtong zhing chos kyi char chen po rab tu 'bebs so //
translated: Those bodhisattva great beings, his foremost sons, having gone from this world to their own buddha-fields, begin with this origination of Dharma and in the presence of those Tathāgatas send down a great rain of Dharma and cause a great rain of Dharma to fall.

original: kun dga' bo; 'di lta ste /🔽dper na / klu'i rgyal po rgya mtsho ni /
analyzed: kun dga' bo; 'di lta ste / dper na / klu'i rgyal po rgya mtsho ni /

original: gang gi tshe rab tu dga' bar gyur pa de'i tshe rang gi gnas nas char gyi rgyun chen po 'bebs so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rab tu dga' bar gyur pa de'i tshe rang gi gnas nas char gyi rgyun chen po 'bebs so //
translated: For example, when the king of nāgas Sāgara is delighted, at that time he sends down a great stream of rain from his abode.

original: gang dag gnas de na gnas par gyur pa'i klu de dag gis kyang char gyi rgyun de mnos nas dga' bar gyur te char gyi rgyun des bde bar shes so //
analyzed: gang dag gnas de na gnas par gyur pa'i klu de dag gis kyang char gyi rgyun de mnos nas dga' bar gyur te char gyi rgyun des bde bar shes so //
translated: The nāgas who live in that place, having received that rain, are delighted and know that the rain is pleasant.

original: gang dag de'i bur gyur pa de dag kyang char gyi rgyun de bzod cing char gyi rgyun des mchog tu dga' ba thob bo //
analyzed: gang dag de'i bur gyur pa de dag kyang char gyi rgyun de bzod cing char gyi rgyun des mchog tu dga' ba thob bo //
translated: Those who are their children also endure that rain and, because of that rain, attain supreme delight.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: klu gzhan dag gis char gyi rgyun de mi bzod la /
analyzed: klu gzhan dag gis char gyi rgyun de mi bzod la /

analyzed: klu gzhan dag gis char gyi rgyun des bde bar mi shes shing char gyi rgyun dag gis dga' bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Other nāgas do not know that that rain is pleasant and do not delight in that rain.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,
