analyzed: de bzhin du gang dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos dkon mchog la lhag par chags pa dang / gang dag de bzhin gshegs @23b pa'i sras kyi thu bo byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dge ba'i rtsa ba byas pa /
translated: in the same way, those who are attached to the Tathāgata’s precious Dharma and those who are the Tathāgata’s chief sons, bodhisattva mahāsattvas who have created roots of virtue,

original: bsam pa rgya che ba /
analyzed: bsam pa rgya che ba /

original: chos zab mo'i tshul las nges par skyes pa de dag ni /
analyzed: chos zab mo'i tshul las nges par skyes pa de dag ni /
translated: They are born from the way of the profound Dharma.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi tshul gyi char chen po 'di bzod do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi tshul gyi char chen po 'di bzod do //

original: thos nas rab tu dga' zhing mgu ste bde bar shes so //
analyzed: thos nas rab tu dga' zhing mgu ste bde bar shes so //
translated: Having heard it, they are delighted, joyful, and know happiness.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas don gyi dbang 'di la brten te bsam pa dag pa'i 'khor du sengge'i sgra chen po sgrog cing chos kyi char chen po 'bebs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas don gyi dbang 'di la brten te bsam pa dag pa'i 'khor du sengge'i sgra chen po sgrog cing chos kyi char chen po 'bebs so //
translated: the Tathāgata, based on this meaning, roars the great lion’s roar in the pure retinue and causes the great rain of Dharma to fall.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

analyzed: dper na / 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po rin po che'i mdzod mang po bsags pa dang ldan pa des /
translated: For example, a universal monarch who possesses many accumulated precious treasuries

analyzed: bu mang po rigs dang ldan zhing ma rgyud kyis kyang dag pa de dag thams cad bkug nas rin po che'i mdzod bgos te /

original: bu gang la yang mi bslu bar byin no //
analyzed: bu gang la yang mi bslu bar byin no //
translated: and gives them to the sons without deceiving any of them.

original: de ltar bgos pa de dag 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po de la dga' ba dang / mgu ba chen po lhag par skyes nas 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po dang don mtshungs par gyur to //
analyzed: de ltar bgos pa de dag 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po de la dga' ba dang / mgu ba chen po lhag par skyes nas 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po dang don mtshungs par gyur to //
translated: The princes, having received their shares, were filled with great joy and satisfaction toward the universal monarch, and they became equal to the universal monarch.

original: snyam ste / bdag bde bar shes so //
analyzed: snyam ste / bdag bde bar shes so //
translated: “I know that I am happy.”

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi rgyal po /
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi rgyal po /

analyzed: rang byung gis kyang sras de dag bsdus nas chos rin po che'i mdzod 'di mnyam par bgos te /
translated: the Self-Existent One, having gathered his sons, equally distributed this treasure of the precious Dharma.

original: sras de dag gang la yang mi slu bas de dag nga la dga' ba dang / mgu ba dang / gus pa cher bskyed cing don mthun pa sangs rgyas kyi rigs mi gcod par gnas so //

translated: Since he did not deceive any of his sons, they greatly increased their joy, satisfaction, and respect toward me, and they remained in accord with me, not severing the lineage of the Buddha.

original: kun dga' bo /🔽sems can gzhan dman pa la mos pa /
analyzed: kun dga' bo / sems can gzhan dman pa la mos pa /

analyzed: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyis bcom pa /

analyzed: kun dga' bo /

analyzed: sems can dbul po rnams ni /

analyzed: rnyed kyang dga' bar kun tu spyod par mi nus shing /

analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: de dag rin po che la mi mkhas pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: kun dga' bo /

analyzed: kun dga' bo /

analyzed: chos rin po che dmigs su med pa /

original: stong pa nyid dang ldan pa /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang ldan pa /

analyzed: sems can dbul po thos pa dang bral ba / thos pa nyams pa /

original: mig dang mi ldan pa'i byis pa de dag ni /
analyzed: mig dang mi ldan pa'i byis pa de dag ni /

analyzed: chos rin po che'i mdzod rnyed kyang ci zhig bya zhes 'dor zhing gzhan la sbyin par sems so //

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: “Ānanda,

original: gdol pa dang / g-yung po dang / smrig ma mkhan dang / dbul bos 'tsho ba'i sems can gang gzhan la las rin po che mang po rnyed na /
analyzed: gdol pa dang / g-yung po dang / smrig ma mkhan dang / dbul bos 'tsho ba'i sems can gang gzhan la las rin po che mang po rnyed na /
translated: if other sentient beings, such as outcastes, untouchables, and poor people, find many precious things,

original: bdag mi spyod de /
analyzed: bdag mi spyod de /
translated: they will not use them themselves.

original: rin thang chung ngur 'tshong zhing 'dor ro //
analyzed: rin thang chung ngur 'tshong zhing 'dor ro //
translated: They will sell them for a low price and give them away.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: “Ānanda,

original: sems can dbul po zhes bya ba de ni /
analyzed: sems can dbul po zhes bya ba de ni /
translated: the term ‘poor sentient beings’

original: mu stegs can thams cad dang / gang mu stegs can gyi nyan thos rnams kyi tshig bla dvags so //
analyzed: mu stegs can thams cad dang / gang mu stegs can gyi nyan thos rnams kyi tshig bla dvags so //
translated: is a synonym for all the tīrthikas and the tīrthika hearers.

original: kun dga' bo /🔽sems can dbul po zhes bya ba de ni /
analyzed: kun dga' bo / sems can dbul po zhes bya ba de ni /
translated: “Ānanda,🔽the term ‘poor sentient beings’

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo //
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo //
translated: is a synonym for foolish ordinary beings.

original: lta ba'i 'dam du bying ba /
analyzed: lta ba'i 'dam du bying ba /
translated: They are called ‘those who have fallen into the mud of views,’

original: dmigs pa can /
analyzed: dmigs pa can /
translated: ‘those who have objects of meditation,’

original: 'ching ba la mngon par zhen pa /
analyzed: 'ching ba la mngon par zhen pa /
translated: ‘those who are attached to bondage,’

analyzed: mtshan ma la spyod pa /

original: lam log par song ba rnams kyi tshig bla dvags te /
analyzed: lam log par song ba rnams kyi tshig bla dvags te /
translated: and ‘those who have gone down the wrong path.’

original: de dag ni /
analyzed: de dag ni /
translated: They are

original: chos rin po che 'di rnyed na /
analyzed: chos rin po che 'di rnyed na /
translated: those who, having obtained this precious Dharma,

original: kun tu spyod mi nus shing 'dor te /
analyzed: kun tu spyod mi nus shing 'dor te /

original: don med par yang gzhan la yang sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: don med par yang gzhan la yang sbyin par byed do //
translated: and who give it to others without purpose.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: gang sangs rgyas kyi sras sangs rgyas kyi spyod yul la spyod pa /
analyzed: gang sangs rgyas kyi sras sangs rgyas kyi spyod yul la spyod pa /
translated: those who are the Buddha’s heirs, who practice the Buddha’s domain,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs rgyun mi gcad par gnas pa de dag chos rin po che 'di la yongs su spyod do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs rgyun mi gcad par gnas pa de dag chos rin po che 'di la yongs su spyod do //
translated: who abide in the lineage of the Tathāgata without interruption, they practice this precious Dharma.

original: rnyed nas kyang chud mi gson cing 'di la rin po cher 'du shes par 'gyur @25a *//
analyzed: rnyed nas kyang chud mi gson cing 'di la rin po cher 'du shes par 'gyur @25a *//
translated: Having obtained it, they do not waste it and perceive it as precious.

original: re; ;kun dga' bo /
analyzed: re; ;kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: was ni / sengge'i sgra sgrog mi nus so //
analyzed: was ni / sengge'i sgra sgrog mi nus so //
translated: a fox cannot roar the lion’s roar.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: gang sengge'i phrug gur gyur la sengge chen pos bskyed pa de dag sengge'i sgra sgrog go /
analyzed: gang sengge'i phrug gur gyur la sengge chen pos bskyed pa de dag sengge'i sgra sgrog go /
translated: those who are the lion’s cubs, raised by the great lion, they roar the lion’s roar.”

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: de bzhin du wa lta bu ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du wa lta bu ni /
translated: in the same way, the jackal-like

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo log par lta ba thams cad de /
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo log par lta ba thams cad de /
translated: are all the foolish ordinary beings with wrong views.

original: de dag gis ni /
analyzed: de dag gis ni /
translated: They are unable

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sengge'i sgra dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sengge'i chen po'i chos yongs su longs spyod par mi nus so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sengge'i sgra dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sengge'i chen po'i chos yongs su longs spyod par mi nus so //
translated: to enjoy the lion’s roar of the Tathāgata, the Dharma of the great lion, the perfect Buddha.

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,🔽those who are the heirs of the perfect Buddha, the great lions of the Buddha,

original: gang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sras sangs rgyas kyi sengge chen po dang / rang byung gi ye shes kyis bskyed pa dag ni /
analyzed: gang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sras sangs rgyas kyi sengge chen po dang / rang byung gi ye shes kyis bskyed pa dag ni /

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sengge'i sgra sgrog cing kun tu spyod do //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sengge'i sgra sgrog cing kun tu spyod do //
translated: they roar the lion’s roar of the perfect Buddha and practice it.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus 'di skad ces gsol to //

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

analyzed: 'di ltar; de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor yongs su dag pa 'dus pa 'di ni /

original: ngo mtshar lags so //
analyzed: ngo mtshar lags so //
translated: is truly amazing.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor /
translated: the retinue of the Tathāgata,

original: rang byung gi 'khor /
analyzed: rang byung gi 'khor /
translated: the retinue of the self-arisen,

original: mi tshugs pa'i 'khor; rdo rje lta bu'i 'khor /
analyzed: mi tshugs pa'i 'khor; rdo rje lta bu'i 'khor /
translated: the retinue that cannot be harmed, the retinue that is like a vajra,

original: mi bsgul / mi bskyod pa /
analyzed: mi bsgul / mi bskyod pa /
translated: the unmoving, unshakable,

original: mi 'khrugs pa'i 'khor yongs su dag pa 'di ni /
analyzed: mi 'khrugs pa'i 'khor yongs su dag pa 'di ni /
translated: and unperturbed retinue that is completely pure.

original: rab tu ngo mtshar lags so //
analyzed: rab tu ngo mtshar lags so //
translated: This is truly amazing!”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One replied to the venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: khyod 'khor 'di'i yon tan yongs su brjod dam /
analyzed: khyod 'khor 'di'i yon tan yongs su brjod dam /
translated: will you describe the qualities of this retinue?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Śāradvatīputra replied, “Blessed One,

original: bdag gis @25b 'khor 'di'i yon tan yongs su brjod par rngo mi thogs lags so //
analyzed: bdag gis @25b 'khor 'di'i yon tan yongs su brjod par rngo mi thogs lags so //
translated: I am not able to describe the qualities of this retinue.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'khor 'di ni /
analyzed: 'khor 'di ni /
translated: this retinue

original: ri rab dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: ri rab dang 'dra ste /
translated: is like Mount Meru,

original: yon tan mtha' yas pa dang ldan pa lags pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: yon tan mtha' yas pa dang ldan pa lags pa'i slad du'o //
translated: because it possesses infinite qualities.”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: shla ra dva ti'i bu /
analyzed: shla ra dva ti'i bu /
translated: “Śāradvatīputra,

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: it is just so.

original: 'khor 'di ni /
analyzed: 'khor 'di ni /
translated: This retinue

original: yon tan mtha' yas pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: yon tan mtha' yas pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: He is endowed with infinite qualities.

original: 'khor 'di'i yon tan gyi mtha' yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang rtogs par mi nus na /
analyzed: 'khor 'di'i yon tan gyi mtha' yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang rtogs par mi nus na /
translated: The perfect buddhas are unable to comprehend the extent of the qualities of this retinue.

original: sems can gzhan thams cad kyis lta ci smos /
analyzed: sems can gzhan thams cad kyis lta ci smos /
translated: What need is there to speak of all other sentient beings?

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: 'khor 'di ni /
analyzed: 'khor 'di ni /
translated: this retinue

original: de bzhin gshegs pas bsdus pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas bsdus pa ma yin zhing /
translated: is not gathered by the Thus-Gone One.

original: 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas rtsol ba ci yang mi mdzad de /
analyzed: 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas rtsol ba ci yang mi mdzad de /
translated: The Thus-Gone One does not exert himself at all in this regard.

original: rang gi dge ba'i rtsa bas nga'i ming thos nas 'khor 'dir 'dus te de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor 'di gang la yang ma gleng ma bsgo bar de dag rang gi dge ba'i rtsa bas bskul nas 'khor 'dir lhags so //🔽'di lta bu'i chos bstan pa la 'di lta bu'i sems can chen po 'du bar 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: rang gi dge ba'i rtsa bas nga'i ming thos nas 'khor 'dir 'dus te de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor 'di gang la yang ma gleng ma bsgo bar de dag rang gi dge ba'i rtsa bas bskul nas 'khor 'dir lhags so // 'di lta bu'i chos bstan pa la 'di lta bu'i sems can chen po 'du bar 'gyur ba ni /
translated: Through their own roots of virtue, they have gathered in this retinue after hearing my name. The Thus-Gone One does not speak or instruct this retinue at all. They have been inspired by their own roots of virtue and have gathered in this retinue.

original: de'i chos nyid do //
analyzed: de'i chos nyid do //
translated: It is the very nature of things that such great beings gather for the teaching of such a Dharma.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: gang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gzhan dag byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod the tshom thams cad gcod pa 'di yang dag par ston pa de dag gi 'khor kyang 'di lta bur 'du bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gzhan dag byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod the tshom thams cad gcod pa 'di yang dag par ston pa de dag gi 'khor kyang 'di lta bur 'du bar 'gyur te /
translated: The retinues of those other Blessed Buddhas who also teach this bodhisattva canon that cuts through all doubts will also gather in this way.

original: 'di lta bu 'di 'dra ba'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor gdon mi za bar 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: 'di lta bu 'di 'dra ba'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor gdon mi za bar 'byung ba ni /
translated: This kind of retinue circle will definitely appear.

original: chos bstan pa 'di'i chos nyid do //
analyzed: chos bstan pa 'di'i chos nyid do //
translated: This is the nature of this Dharma teaching.

original: kun dga' bo'i le'u zhes bya ste /
analyzed: kun dga' bo'i le'u zhes bya ste /
translated: This is the chapter of Ānanda,

original: gnyis pa'o //// de nas bcom ldan @26a *//
analyzed: gnyis pa'o //// de nas bcom ldan @26a *//
translated: the second.

original: 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the bodhisattva great being Suvikrāntavikrāmin:

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
translated: “Suvikrāntavikrāmin,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa /
translated: the perfection of wisdom,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: the perfection of wisdom—

original: byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhe na /
translated: what is the bodhisattvas’ perfection of wisdom?

original: gang chos thams cad kyi tshu rol rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang chos thams cad kyi tshu rol rtogs pa ste /
translated: It is the realization of the near side of all phenomena.

original: de ni bstan par mi nus mod kyi /
analyzed: de ni bstan par mi nus mod kyi /
translated: It cannot be taught.

original: ji ltar khyed shes par 'gyur ba dang / ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa tha snyad kyi tshig tu 'gyur ba de ltar rab tu bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar khyed shes par 'gyur ba dang / ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa tha snyad kyi tshig tu 'gyur ba de ltar rab tu bshad par bya'o //
translated: But I will teach it so that you will understand it, and so that the perfection of wisdom will become a conventional expression.

original: gzugs shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin te /
translated: Form is not the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gzugs las gzhan pa yang ma yin no //🔽de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gzugs las gzhan pa yang ma yin no // de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is not other than form.

original: de ltar tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par shes pa las gzhan pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par shes pa las gzhan pa yang ma yin no //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is not other than consciousness.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
translated: Subhūti,

original: gzugs kyi pha rol gang yin pa de gzugs ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi pha rol gang yin pa de gzugs ma yin no //
translated: the perfection of form is not form.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same way,

original: de ltar tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i pha rol gang yin pa de rnam par shes pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i pha rol gang yin pa de rnam par shes pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The other side of feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness is not consciousness.

original: gzugs kyi pha rol ji lta bar gzugs kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi pha rol ji lta bar gzugs kyang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as there is an other side of form, so it is with form.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du @26b byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i pha rol ji lta bar rnam par shes pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du @26b byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i pha rol ji lta bar rnam par shes pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as there is an other side of feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness, so it is with consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa'i pha rol ji lta bar chos thams cad kyang de bzhin no //🔽chos thams cad kyi pha rol gang yin pa de dag ni /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i pha rol ji lta bar chos thams cad kyang de bzhin no // chos thams cad kyi pha rol gang yin pa de dag ni /
translated: Just as there is an other side of consciousness, so it is with all phenomena.

original: chos thams cad ma yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad ma yin no //
translated: The other side of all phenomena is not all phenomena.

original: chos thams cad kyi pha rol ji lta bar chos thams cad kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi pha rol ji lta bar chos thams cad kyang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as there is an other side of all phenomena, so it is with all phenomena.

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
translated: Suvikrāntavikrāmin,

original: de la gzugs kyi pha rol gang yin pa de /🔽gzugs ma yin no //
analyzed: de la gzugs kyi pha rol gang yin pa de / gzugs ma yin no //
translated: the other side of form is not form.🔽Suvikrāntavikrāmin,

original: zhes bya ba de ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de ni /
translated: the other side of form is not form.

original: gzugs kyi 'brel ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'brel ba bstan pa'o //
translated: The connection with form is taught.

original: gzugs kyi pha rol ji lta bar gzugs kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi pha rol ji lta bar gzugs kyang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as is the other side of form, so is form.

original: zhes bya ba de ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de ni /
translated: This is

original: gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid bshad pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid bshad pa bstan pa'o //
translated: the teaching on the explanation of the essence of form.🔽This is

original: de ni / gzugs kyi ji lta ba bzhin bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ni / gzugs kyi ji lta ba bzhin bstan pa'o //
translated: the teaching on the suchness of form.🔽This is

original: de ni / gzugs kyi rang bzhin bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ni / gzugs kyi rang bzhin bstan pa'o //
translated: the teaching on the nature of form.🔽This is

original: de ni / gzugs kyi mi dmigs pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ni / gzugs kyi mi dmigs pa bstan pa'o //
translated: the teaching on the non-apprehension of form.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i pha rol gang yin pa de /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i pha rol gang yin pa de /
translated: Likewise, the other side of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness is

original: rnam par shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ma yin no //
translated: not consciousness.

original: zhes bya ba de ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de ni /
translated: This is

original: rnam par shes pa'i 'brel ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i 'brel ba bstan pa'o //
translated: the teaching on the connection with consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa'i pha rol ji lta bar rnam par shes pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i pha rol ji lta bar rnam par shes pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as is the other side of consciousness, so is consciousness.

original: zhes bya ba de ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de ni /
translated: This is

original: rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid bshad pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid bshad pa bstan pa'o //
translated: the teaching on the explanation of the essence of consciousness.

original: de ni / rnam par shes pa'i ji lta ba bzhin dang / rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin dang / rnam par shes pa mi dmigs pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ni / rnam par shes pa'i ji lta ba bzhin dang / rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin dang / rnam par shes pa mi dmigs pa bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching on the suchness of consciousness, the nature of consciousness, and the non-apprehension of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa'i pha rol ji lta bar chos thams cad kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i pha rol ji lta bar chos thams cad kyang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as is the other shore of consciousness, so are all phenomena.

original: zhes bya ba dang / chos thams cad kyi pha rol gang yin pa @27a *//
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / chos thams cad kyi pha rol gang yin pa @27a *//
translated: And just as is the other shore of all phenomena,

original: de dag chos thams cad ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag chos thams cad ma yin no //
translated: that is not all phenomena.

translated: This is the teaching on the suchness of all phenomena, the nature of all phenomena, and the non-apprehension of all phenomena.

original: chos thams cad kyi ji lta ba bzhin dang / chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin dang / chos thams cad kyi mi dmigs pa ji lta bar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang de bzhin te /

translated: The perfection of wisdom is just like the suchness of all phenomena, the nature of all phenomena, and the nonapprehension of all phenomena.

translated: There is no one who instigates or causes form to arise.

original: kun nas slong ba po gang yang med de /🔽gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la slong ba po yang med /🔽kun nas slong ba po yang med pa gang yin pa de /

translated: Similarly, there is no one who instigates or causes feeling, perception, formation, or consciousness to arise.🔽Form, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are not instigated or caused to arise.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The absence of instigation and the absence of causation in regard to form, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness is the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /🔽gzugs shes pa'am /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa / gzugs shes pa'am /

translated: Similarly, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are not known or caused to be known.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams su gtogs pa yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams su gtogs pa yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is not included in the desire realm, the form realm, or the formless realm.

original: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas su gtogs pa yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas su gtogs pa yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is not included in the compounded or the uncompounded.

original: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i chos su gtogs pa yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i chos su gtogs pa yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is not included in mundane, supramundane, contaminated, or uncontaminated phenomena.

original: dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i chos su gtogs pa yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin /
analyzed: dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i chos su gtogs pa yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is not included in virtuous or nonvirtuous phenomena.

original: sems can gyi khams su gtogs pa yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin zhing /🔽chos de dag las rnam @40a *//
analyzed: sems can gyi khams su gtogs pa yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin zhing / chos de dag las rnam @40a *//
translated: The perfection of wisdom is not included in the realm of sentient beings.

original: par grol ba yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: par grol ba yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is not liberated from those phenomena.

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
translated: Subhūti,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: The perfection of wisdom

original: chos gang du yang gtogs pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: chos gang du yang gtogs pa yang ma yin /
translated: is not included in any phenomenon

original: mi gtogs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mi gtogs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: and is not excluded from any phenomenon.

original: gang gtogs pa dang / gang mi gtogs pa'i chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / ji lta ba bzhin gyi de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: gang gtogs pa dang / gang mi gtogs pa'i chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / ji lta ba bzhin gyi de bzhin nyid de /
translated: The suchness, the unmistaken suchness, the unaltered suchness, and the real nature of the phenomena that are included and excluded

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //🔽rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /🔽de bzhin nyid ces bya ba de /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o // rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa / de bzhin nyid ces bya ba de /
translated: is the perfection of wisdom.🔽“Subhūti,

original: gang gi tshig bla dvags yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshig bla dvags yin zhe na /
translated: what is the meaning of suchness?

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
translated: Subhūti,

original: ji ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis dmigs pa'i chos de dag ni /🔽de bzhin du ma yin zhing /
analyzed: ji ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis dmigs pa'i chos de dag ni / de bzhin du ma yin zhing /
translated: the phenomena that are perceived by foolish, ordinary beings🔽are not like that,

original: gzhan du yang ma yin /
analyzed: gzhan du yang ma yin /
translated: and they are not otherwise.

original: ji ltar chos rnams de bzhin gshegs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos dang / byang chub sems dpas mthong ba'i chos de lta bu ni /
analyzed: ji ltar chos rnams de bzhin gshegs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos dang / byang chub sems dpas mthong ba'i chos de lta bu ni /
translated: The Dharma is seen by the Tathāgata, by the śrāvakas of the Tathāgata, and by the bodhisattvas.

original: de bzhin nyid /🔽ma nor ba de bzhin nyid /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid /
translated: That is thusness.🔽It is the unmistaken thusness.

original: gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid de /
translated: It is the thusness that is not otherwise.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called thusness.

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
translated: Subhūti,

original: 'di ni / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa'o //
translated: this is the teaching of the perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas.

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
translated: Subhūti,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /🔽chos gang 'bri ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni / chos gang 'bri ba'i phyir ram /
translated: this perfection of wisdom

original: 'phel ba'i phyir nye bar gnas pa ma yin no //🔽chos gang 'du ba'i phyir ram /🔽'bral ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: 'phel ba'i phyir nye bar gnas pa ma yin no // chos gang 'du ba'i phyir ram / 'bral ba'i phyir ram /
translated: is not present in order to diminish or increase any phenomenon.🔽It is not present in order to gather or disperse any phenomenon.

original: bri @40b ba'i phyir ram /🔽gang ba'i phyir ram /🔽gsog pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: bri @40b ba'i phyir ram / gang ba'i phyir ram / gsog pa'i phyir ram /
translated: It is not present in order to diminish or increase any phenomenon.🔽It is not present in order to fill or empty any phenomenon.

original: mi gsog pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: mi gsog pa'i phyir ram /
translated: It is not present in order to accumulate or not accumulate any phenomenon.

original: 'pho ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: 'pho ba'i phyir ram /
translated: because of transference,

original: mi 'pho ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: mi 'pho ba'i phyir ram /
translated: because of non-transference,

original: skye ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: skye ba'i phyir ram /
translated: because of birth,

original: 'gog pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i phyir ram /

analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyir ram /

analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i phyir ram /
translated: because of purification,

analyzed: 'jug pa'i phyir ram /

analyzed: ldog pa'i phyir ram /

analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i phyir ram /

analyzed: nub pa'i phyir ram /

analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi phyir ram /

analyzed: mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ram /

analyzed: mnyam pa'i phyir ram /

analyzed: bde ba'i phyir ram /

translated: because of impermanence,🔽because of beauty,

analyzed: bdag gi phyir ram /

analyzed: bdag med pa'i phyir ram /

analyzed: mi 'byung ba'i phyir ram /
